City of Fairfield Police Department
August 22 at 4:22 PM ¬∑

Do you know what the traffic laws are when students get on and off buses? Motorists are required to stop at least 10 feet in front of or behind a school bus when flashing lights and an extended arm are displayed and cannot resume driving until the school bus begins moving. Those traveling on two or three lanes, all lanes must stop.

In Ohio, on four or more lanes of traffic, only the traffic traveling in the same direction must stop. The Fairfield Police Department also reminds motorists to plan ahead and allow extra time for school bus stops.

‚Ä¢ Complete a mandatory essay describing her goals and how the scholarship would help her education
‚Ä¢ Write an additional 500 word essay on one of three topics
‚Ä¢ Provide a letter of recommendation
‚Ä¢ Provide high school transcript
‚Ä¢ Provide an acceptance letter from a college or university

Good Afternoon FCSD Families,

Today the Fairfield City School District Food Service Department with the help of teachers, administrators, and community volunteers served 1,200 students a total of 6,000 lunches and 6,000 breakfasts. Good Afternoon FCSD Families,

Today the Fairfield City School District Food Service Department with the help of teachers, administrators, and community volunteers served 1,200 students a total of 6,000 lunches and 6,000 breakfasts. As we prepared for the meal system today, we based the number of lunches prepared on the number that were prepared and served prior to spring break.

The preparation and coordination of this system is challenging due to COVID-19 restrictions and obstacles. We met today to review plans and increase our prepared lunches and breakfasts to provide meals for over 2,000 children. This is an increase of nearly 80% of what we prepared for today.

As families plan to pick up food for their children next week we suggest you arrive as early to the 11 a.m. start time as possible, as the meals are provided on a first-come, first-served basis. While we believe the significant increase in meals will drastically improve our service, we cannot ensure that we will not run out of food.
